alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 29 at 1:54PM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Buffalo Pass, Dilkon, Ganado, Shonto and Window Rock. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could led to very difficult travel on New Years Eve. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Snow forecast from 5 AM Friday to 11 AM Saturday: Buffalo Pass 7 to 11 inches Dilkon 2 to 4 inches Ganado 4 to 6 inches Shonto 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 4 to 6 inches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
